DOC.brief_summary: This pilot protocol aim evaluate effectiveness safety electroacupuncture therapy post-stroke patient urinary incontinence .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Safety Electroacupuncture Poststroke Urinary Incontinence
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female age 19 year old 2 . Patients diagnose stroke ( cerebral hemorrhage infarction ) examination compute tomography magnetic resonance image method within 2 year 3 . Twice urination 3 4 point PPIUS* baseline OR 13 point KIPSS* 4 . Any volunteer sign informed consent form We exclude patient 1 . Once postvoiding residual > 200 ml per day 2 . Clinically significant stress urinary incontinence diagnose base cough induction test investigator 's decision 3 . Recurrent urinary tract infection define 4 treatment urinary tract infection recent 1 year 4 . Cognitive impairment le 23 point MMSEK* examination 5 . Acute chronic low urinary tract infection examine urine culture 6 . Urinary incontinence diagnose stroke occur symptom continue base medical history 7 . Any severe disease low urinary tract base medical history screen examination 8 . Coagulation disorder base medical history 9 . Peripheral arterial disease , result take medical surgical procedure treat base medical history 10 . Psychiatric disease base medical history 11 . Fear acupuncture base questionnaire test 12 . Pregnancy base urine test 13 . Any inappropriate reason primary sub investigator let patient participate trial Abbreviations PPIUS ; Patient Perception Intensity Urgency Scale KIPSS ; The Korean version International Prostate Symptom Scale MMSEK ; The Korean version MiniMental State Examination
